clothes and putting them in boxes to ship home and started giving us all the same uniform and then they marched us over they marched us over to the barber and they set this boy down you know he's one of these pretty boys and the farmer said how do you want your hair son he said just take a living off the side and kind of blocking across the back he said no problem yeah he filled him like an onion true story didn't bother me I didn't have much to lose but here we were all recruits but they turned us into soldiers by being taught to endure hardness the hardness that we endured in basic made of soldiers the officers instilled into us the Army's concept of discipline and obedience we endured hours of drilling endless parades nowrap marches constant pressure tasteless food guard duty without sleep bullying my sergeants lectures exposure to inclement weather the whole procedure was designed to toughen us up to make us ready for battle the Roman soldiers of Paul's day were the toughest the
